publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5081 Mr Stewart Maxwell: Scotland Welcomes the British Transplant Games—That the Parliament supports the British Transplant Games, due to take place in Edinburgh in 2007; congratulates the organisers, the Transplant Sports Association of Great Britain, on highlighting that people who receive transplants can go on to have a full, fit and fulfilling life; urges politicians, business and members of the public to do all that they can to support these games, and looks forward to a highly successful event in Scotland next year.

S2M-5081 Mr Stewart Maxwell: Scotland Welcomes the British Transplant Games—That the Parliament supports the British Transplant Games, due to take place in Edinburgh in 2007; congratulates the organisers, the Transplant Sports Association of Great Britain, on highlighting that people who receive transplants can go on to have a full, fit and fulfilling life; urges politicians, business and members of the public to do all that they can to support these games, and looks forward to a highly successful event in Scotland next year. Supported by: Robin Harper*, Jim Mather*, Karen Gillon*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Stewart Stevenson*, Shiona Baird*, Michael McMahon*, Rob Gibson*, Alex Johnstone*, Alex Neil*, Trish Godman*, Eleanor Scott*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr John Swinney*, Mr David Davidson*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Bruce Crawford*, Ms Maureen Watt*, John Swinburne*
S2M-5081 Scotland Welcomes the British Transplant Games (lodged on 2 November 2006) Brian Adam*, Dave Petrie*
S2M-5081 Scotland Welcomes the British Transplant Games (lodged on 2 November 2006) Dennis Canavan*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-5081 Scotland Welcomes the British Transplant Games (lodged on 2 November 2006) Ms Sandra White*, Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-5081 Scotland Welcomes the British Transplant Games (lodged on 2 November 2006) Frances Curran*
S2M-5081 Scotland Welcomes the British Transplant Games (lodged on 2 November 2006) Cathy Peattie*
